title: Potato and Chicken in Lemon (batata lamon)
summary: Potato and Chicken in Lemon is a traditional family recipe. It is typically prepared for family gatherings and special occasions. The recipe has been passed down through generations and is cherished for its zesty and savory flavors.
ingredients: 4 potatoes, peeled and cut into wedges
instructions: In a large bowl, mix the olive oil, lemon juice, minced garlic, dried oregano, salt, and pepper.
Add the chicken thighs and potato wedges to the bowl, and toss to coat them evenly with the marinade.
Place the chicken and potatoes in a baking dish, making sure they are evenly distributed.
Bake in the preheated oven for 45-50 minutes, or until the chicken is cooked through and the potatoes are golden and crispy.
Garnish with fresh parsley before serving.
source: Frida (grandmom) recipe - (my mom give me the recipe)

title: Couscous with Vegetable Soup
summary: Couscous with Vegetable Soup is a beloved family dish often prepared for festive meals and large family gatherings. It combines fluffy couscous with a hearty and flavorful vegetable soup.
instructions: In a large pot, heat the olive oil over medium heat.
Add the chopped onion and cook until translucent.
Add the diced carrots, zucchinis, and red bell pepper, and cook for about 5 minutes.
Stir in the chickpeas, diced tomatoes, vegetable broth, ground cumin, ground coriander, salt, and pepper.
Bring the soup to a boil, then reduce the heat and let it simmer for about 30-40 minutes, or until the vegetables are tender.
While the soup is simmering, prepare the couscous according to the package instructions.
Serve the vegetable soup over a bed of couscous and garnish with fresh cilantro.

title: Matbukha
summary: Matbukha is a traditional family dish served as a starter or side dish during family dinners and celebrations. It features a rich and spicy tomato and pepper mixture, slow-cooked to perfection.
instructions: Heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
Add the minced garlic and cook until fragrant.
Add the chopped red and green bell peppers, and cook for about 10 minutes, until they start to soften.
Stir in the chopped tomatoes, paprika, ground cumin, sugar, salt, and pepper.
Reduce the heat to low and let the mixture simmer for about 1.5 to 2 hours, stirring occasionally, until it thickens and the flavors meld together.
Serve warm or at room temperature, garnished with fresh parsley.
occasion: Every friday dinner with the whole family
